etymology.description: Pictogram of an upside-down human figure (inverted 大 (dà, "big")) -> emphasizes opposite, backwards
etymology.interpretation: The character 屰 (nì, "opposite") depicts a human figure turned upside down, visually representing the concept of being contrary or reversed, which aligns with its meaning 'opposite.' The addition of a horizontal stroke in later script versions may have been intended to accentuate the inversion, making the meaning clearer.
